title: Which one is correct? Everyone know or everyone knows? - Quora

response.answer_text: Here are a few resources: Subject-Verb Agreement Subject-verb agreement (Khan Academy) “The indefinite pronouns anyone, everyone, someone, no one and nobody are always singular and take singular verbs.” (Subject-verb agreement) ‘Everyone knows’ is correct. The confusion must be because you’re assuming that ‘everyone’ is plural, right? Think of it like this: ‘everyone’ actually refers to ‘every single one’ present. Now, if you were to substitute my phrase, would you say ‘every single one know?’ Seems fairly obvious that it should be ‘every single one knows,’ right? This is because you are actually referring to every single person, as in ‘every one of us.’ You’re actually using an indefinite pronoun, as explained above, but it might be helpful to think of it this way. The same goes for ‘no one’ or ‘each of us’ or ‘anyone’ or ‘no one’…

Everyone Knows is the correct answers. Everyone come under, 3rd person singular pronoun.In the Simple present tense, with every singular 3rd person noun or pronoun, ‘s’ is added to the verb.For Example:I eat an apple. (1st person singular, simple present tense)You eat an apple. (2nd person singular, simple present tense)He eats an apple. (3rd person singular, simple present tense)And so the correct ans is: Everyone knows
